avalancheActivity.comment:
A lot of new snow to above 800 m: The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. The moderate wind will transport the snow. The fresh wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach large size. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on steep slopes above the tree line.
In particular on steep shady slopes avalanches can be released in deep layers of the snowpack. The avalanche prone locations are quite prevalent and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As the snowfall becomes more intense the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow and wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack above the tree line. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. On Friday medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
New snow to above 1000 m. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. The large wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can also penetrate deep layers and reach large size.
The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack can indicate the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: Since Wednesday on steep shady slopes numerous medium-sized to large avalanches were released. The new snow and wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack above the tree line. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
New snow to below the tree line. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. The large wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can in some cases penetrate deep layers and reach large size.
The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack can indicate the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow and wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack above the tree line. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. In the last few days on steep slopes medium-sized and large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment: A lot of snow will fall from early morning. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. This snow as well as the wind slabs to be found above the tree line represent the main danger. The wind slabs can in some cases be released easily, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As the snowfall becomes more intense the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs will form.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment: Down to 900 m snow will fall from early morning. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. This snow as well as the wind slabs to be found above the tree line represent the main danger. The wind slabs can in some cases be released easily, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As the snowfall becomes more intense the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs will form.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
